abstract: Michel Peissel, French explorer and ethnologist who devoted much of his life to recording Tibetan culture and led numerous expeditions to seldom-traveled places, dies at age 74.
snippet: Mr. Peissel explored remote regions of the globe, including the Tibetan high plateau, remote Russian river towns and unrecorded Mayan ruins.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Peissel explored remote regions of the globe, including the Tibetan high plateau, remote Russian river towns and unrecorded Mayan ruins.

headline.main: Michel Peissel, Tibet Expert and Adventurer, Dies at 74
headline.print_headline: Michel Peissel, Tibet Expert and Adventurer, Dies at 74
headline.seo: Michel Peissel, Tibet Scholar and Adventurer, Dies at 74
